name: Hagia Sophia
description: Museum with glittering mosaics of Biblical scenes in vast, domed former Byzantine church and mosque.

name: Sultan Ahmed Mosque
description: Well-known site, also known as the Blue Mosque, built in 1616 & containing its founder's tomb.

name: Bosporus
description: Boat tours provide visitors with unique city views from this strait separating Europe & Asia.

name: Topkapı Palace
description: Huge, opulent 15th-century palace, occupied by sultans for 400 years, housing Ottoman treasures.

name: Grand Bazaar
description: Historic sprawling network of indoor souks & market streets peddling leather, jewelry & gifts.

name: Taksim Square
description: Fanning out from Taksim Square with its Republic Monument, Taksim is a busy nightlife, shopping and dining district. Vintage trams trundle along Istiklal Caddesi, the city’s main pedestrian boulevard

name: Basilica Cistern
description: Huge underground Roman water source held up with 336 marble columns covering 9,800 sq. meters.

name: Dolmabahçe Palace
tagline: Museum in ornate Ottoman sultan's palace
description: Grand, domed sultan's palace, now a museum, including collections of art, calligraphy and carpets.

name: Galata Tower
description: Restored 5th-century tower and former prison overlooking the Bosphorus with top-floor restaurant.

name: Hippodrome of Constantinople
description: Public square with remnants of an ancient hippodrome, with prominent & historic buildings nearby.

name: Spice Bazaar
description: Covered, 17th-century market known as the Egyptian Bazaar, with spice, food & textile shops.

name: Golden Horn
description: Horn-shaped estuary, the primary inlet on the Bosporus, featuring a bustling commercial hub & parks.

name: İstiklal Avenue
tagline: Busy city avenue with shops & cafes
description: Bustling city thoroughfare known for its boutiques, galleries, theaters & numerous eateries.

name: Süleymaniye Mosque
description: Ornate 16th-century mosque with gardens, a restaurant & a terrace with views over the Golden Horn.

name: Maiden's Tower
tagline: Iconic islet tower with boat trips
description: Structure linked with legend & once used as a lighthouse, housing a small museum & a restaurant.

name: Bosphorus Bridge
tagline: The Bosphorus Bridge, known officially as the 15 July Martyrs Bridge and unofficially as the First Bridge, is one of the three suspension bridges spanning the Bosphorus strait in Istanbul, Turkey

name: Rumelihisarı
description: Hilltop 15th-century fortress with multiple towers, walking paths & water views.

name: Galata Bridge
tagline: Modern bridge spanning the Golden Horn
description: Bustling bridge across the Golden Horn with pedestrian walkways & street vendors, with cafes below.

name: Büyükada
description: Büyükada is the largest of the nine so-called Princes' Islands in the Sea of Marmara, near Istanbul, with an area of about 2 square miles. It is officially a neighbourhood in the Adalar district

name: Chora Church
description: Museum of religious art on the site of a church that was first built here in the 6th century A.D.

name: Beylerbeyi Palace
description: This 19th-century palace with gardens was once a summer residence for Ottoman sultans.

name: Ortaköy Mosque
tagline: Baroque mosque built to capture light
description: Restored Baroque Revival mosque featuring windows designed to capture the Bosphorus' changing light.

name: New Mosque
description: Prominent mosque dating to the 17th century, featuring iconic domes & a dramatic interior.

name: İstanbul Archaeology Museums
description: Neoclassical museum showing the country's rich archaeological heritage within landscaped gardens.

name: Ciragan Palace Kempinski
tagline: Palatial hotel with a spa & a helipad
description: Lavish lodging in an ornate former palace with dining & a spa, plus an infinity pool & a helipad.

name: Miniatürk
tagline: Turkey transformed into a model village
description: Well-known Turkish sights including the Blue Mosque depicted in miniature format in model village.

name: Gülhane Park
tagline: Serene city park with gardens & a museum
description: Venerable, tranquil forested park featuring gardens, paths, a creek & a science museum.

name: Rüstem Pasha Mosque
tagline: Historic mosque famous for its tile work
description: Ottoman mosque from the 16th century decorated with a wide range of floral & geometric tile designs.

name: Eyüp Sultan Mosque
description: A friend of the prophet Muhammad is thought to be buried at this 15-century mosque rebuilt in 1800.

name: Obelisk of Theodosius
description: Egyptian obelisk with circa-1400 B.C. hieroglyphics, re-erected here in the 4th century A.D.

name: Çamlıca Hill
description: Çamlıca Hill, aka Big Çamlıca Hill to differentiate from the nearby Little Çamlıca Hill, is a hill in Üsküdar district of Istanbul, Turkey. Situated on the Asian part of the city at 268 m above

name: Heybeliada
tagline: Small inhabited island with a monastery
description: Small island with a hilltop Greek Orthodox monastery, navy school & small harbour with cafés.

name: Turkish and Islamic Arts Museum
tagline: Turkish & Islamic arts in a palace
description: Palace museum of Islamic & Turkish art, opened in 1983 & displaying ceramics, carpets & glassware.

name: Fatih Sultan Mehmet Bridge
description: Striking, 4-lane suspension bridge spanning the Bosphorus strait, connecting Europe to Asia.

name: Hagia Irene
description: Byzantine, former Orthodox church dating from the 4th century, open as a museum.

name: Serpent Column
description: Ancient Greek bronze column with missing serpent heads, made to commemorate a historic battle.

name: Yıldız Palace
tagline: Museum in palace complex from the 1880s
description: Museum with gardens in a sprawling 19th-century residence once home to members of the royal court.

name: Little Hagia Sophia
description: Landmark domed mosque in a former 6th century Byzantine church with an Ottoman-style interior.

name: Istanbul Modern Art Museum
description: Riverside museum with Turkish & international modern & contemporary art collections, plus a cinema.

name: Emirgan Park
tagline: Picturesque park with play areas & paths
description: Lush public park featuring an array of plants, 2 ponds, jogging paths & play equipment for kids.

name: Anadoluhisarı
description: At the narrowest part of the Bosphurus, this imposing fort gives its name to the surrounding area.

name: Column of Constantine
tagline: Ancient Roman column built of stone
description: Recently restored column atop a stone pedestal built by the ancient Romans as a monument.

name: German Fountain
description: Elaborately decorated fountain built in 1598 & adorned with mirrors & floral motifs.

name: Valens Aqueduct
tagline: Remains of an ancient stone water system
description: Imposing remains of an ancient aqueduct whose double-decker archways now straddle traffic.

name: Burgazada
tagline: Remote island with a museum & ruins
description: Accessibly by boat only, this island houses the Sait Faik museum & ruins of a 9th-century monastery.

name: Vialand
description: Theme park featuring amusement rides for all ages & a shopping center with dining & entertainment.

name: Yıldız Park
tagline: City park with an Ottoman palace museum
description: Suburban public park with cafes & a hilltop museum in an Ottoman palace dating from the 1880s.

name: Nişantaşı
description: Nişantaşı is an upscale residential area that's popular for its fashion boutiques selling international and prominent local labels. Art nouveau buildings house trendy restaurants serving Turkish

name: Küçüksu Palace
description: This Neo-Baroque waterfront palace built as a summer residence for Ottoman sultans offers tours.

name: Istanbul Aquarium
tagline: Large aquarium with a gift shop & cafes
description: Big aquarium complex with around 1,500 species in many large tanks, plus a gift shop & eateries.
